intro: Chordifex gracilior, commonly known as the slender liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant characterized by its small, flattened, and often ribbon-like leaves. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Chordifex gracilior has a thalloid structure, meaning its body is not differentiated into true stems and leaves. It reproduces via spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia located on the underside of its leaves.
